s.text: ' He never would come right out and say it," Woodward writes.
The new grail is the "conceptual scoop"--the fresh frame that some smart analyst can put on events, not the events themselves.
The new grail is the "conceptual scoop"--the fresh frame that some smart analyst can put on events, not the events themselves.
The new grail is the "conceptual scoop"--the fresh frame that some smart analyst can put on events, not the events themselves.
Which leads to a second reaction: The reporting, if one defines reporting in its smallest-bore sense, is sometimes breathtaking.
In every case, family members, who in an earlier age would have been enthusiastic, urged them to stay out.
The first reaction is that it is not really a book.
